column1: Pulmonary aspergilloma is a mass caused by a fungal infection that usually grows in lung cavities.
Aspergillomas are formed when the fungus Aspergillus grows in a clump in a lung cavity, or invades healthy tissue, causing an abscess.
The most common species of fungus that causes disease in humans is Aspergillus fumigatus.
Cavities in the lung may be caused by: - Tuberculosis - Coccidioidomycosis - Cystic fibrosis - Histoplasmosis - Lung abscess - Lung cancer - Sarcoidosis See also: Aspergillosis
